name: "Hairspray" the Movie Trivia Quiz | Hairspray (1988) | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year was "Hairspray" released in the US?
questions.explanation:
1988.

	The official release date was February 26, 1988.

John Waters.

	John Waters also directed "Polyester", "Pink Flamingos" and "Serial Mom".

questions.text: What state did "Hairspray" take place in?
questions.explanation:
Maryland.

	The movie was set in the early 60's in Baltimore, Maryland.

questions.text: What small role did Ric Ocasek (from the band "The Cars") have?
questions.explanation:
beatnik.

	Pia Zadora played opposite Ric Ocasek as his beatnik girlfriend.

questions.text: Ricki Lake starred as Tracy Turnblad.
questions.explanation:
true.

	Ricki went on to star in another John Waters movie, "Serial Mom". She is probably best known as being a talk show hostess.

questions.text: What was the name of the TV dance show that Tracy made a big impact on?
questions.explanation:
The Corny Collins Show.

	The fictional Corny Collins Show was based on a real show called "The Buddy Deane Show."

questions.text: What was name of Tracy's rival and arch enemy?
questions.explanation:
Amber Von Tussle.

	Colleen Fitzpatrick played the jealous Amber who tried in vain to be better then Tracy.

questions.text: Amber's parents were played by Sonny Bono and Debbie Harry.
questions.explanation:
True.

	They played Franklin and Velma Von Tussle.

Penny Pingleton.

	Leslie Ann Powers played her best friend Penny. Joann Havrilla portrayed Penny's overprotective mother, Prudence.

questions.text: Who said "Oh Papa Tooney! We've got a Looney!"
questions.explanation:
Motormouth Mabel.

	Motormouth Mabel was played by R&B singer Ruth Brown.
